channel.title: q-fin.MF updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: q-fin.MF updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On non-uniqueness in the option valuation problem
item.description: arXiv:2501.18721v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: It is known that the value of a call option in the case of constant elasticity processes (CEV) with the indicator $\alpha$ exceeding the critical $\alpha=1$ is determined in a non-unique way. We show how, based on an already existing mathematical theory concerning the correctness of boundary conditions for degenerate parabolic equations on the semi-axis $[0,\infty)$, this phenomenon can be explained. Namely, for $1<\alpha\le \frac32$ the non-uniqueness is due to the fact that the initial data of the call option are outside the T\"acklind class, and for $\alpha> \frac32$ it is due to the absence boundary condition for $x=\infty$.
item.dc:creator: Ekaterina A. Ladykova, Olga S. Rozanova
